item.title: Amanda add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Benjamin Zander
item.description: "In the measurement world, you set a goal and strive for it. In the universe of possibility, you set the context and let life unfold." -- Benjamin Zander

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Ina Garten
item.description: "You can be miserable before you have a cookie and you can be miserable after you eat a cookie but you can't be miserable while you are eating a cookie." -- Ina Garten

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Faith ― acceptance of which we imagine to be true, that which we cannot prove." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rebecca Wells
item.description: "…the love we most cherish will, of necessity, bring us pain. Because that love is like the setting of a body with broken bones. But I want to stage the setting. I want to direct all scenes." -- Rebecca Wells

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "But I don’t want to go among mad people," Alice remarked. "Oh, you can’t help that," said the Cat: "we’re all mad here. I’m mad. You’re mad." "How do you know I’m mad?" said Alice. "You must be," said the Cat, or you wouldn’t have come here." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Amanda add a quote by George Orwell
Amanda add a quote by Geraldine Brooks
item.description: "I took the T from Logan airport to Harvard Square. I hate driving in Boston. It's the traffic that drives me spare, and the absolutely terrible manners of the motorists. Other New Englanders refer to Massachusetts drivers as "Massholes." -- Geraldine Brooks

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Kathy Reichs
item.description: "She wanted to feel safe. Untouchable in her home. The ultimate female fantasy." -- Kathy Reichs

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman
